content: all in one elephant amigurumi pattern by criss wall i had a huge collection of half balls of yarn i really wanted to use them instead of throwing them out so i started crocheting small toys to leave around for people to find they turned out to be so popular i just can t stop making them i know that there are a few lovely elephant patterns out there already but some of them can take hours to finish i wanted to create a small series of patterns that take around 30 mins to complete and do not involve sewing additional parts onto the work notes  please use your choice of hook size for this pattern based on the yarn thickness but as a guide for 8ply/dk i use a 3 5mm for 10ply/aran i use a 4 0mm hook  you will need 6mm or 7mm safety eyes or you can embroider eyes on after  they measure around 13cm 5 inches long and 5cm 2 inches high  you will need to keep track of the start and finish of each row in this pattern the feet and ears are placed in certain stitches in the row  yarn required using a 3 5mm hook 20 metres 22 yards stitches us terms  chain  single_crochet single_crochet  half_double_crochet half_double_crochet  double_crochet double_crochet  increase increase  decrease decrease  6 double_crochet bobble a loose bobble stitch made with 6 half worked double_crochet s 7 loops on your hook then pull through all of them do not chain 1 to close the bobble  front loop work in the front loop stitch only criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-elephant instructions because the feet and ears need to be placed in certain stitches it is a recommended to use a stitch marker or run a thread through the elephant to mark the end of the row this pattern is worked in the round without joining tail chain 7 slip_stitch in each chain back to the beginning excluding the last chain this last chain space now doubles as our new magic ring this pattern begins with the tail but if you find the start difficult you can easily substitute a magic_ring with 6 single_crochet and begin from there when you have completed a few row just tie in a tail after row 1 single_crochet 6 into the last stitch 6 stitches if you crochet over two strands of the starting chain it makes a smaller hole these 6 single_crochet s are the start of the elephant s rump continue with row 2 without joining the tail needs to be bent towards you so the first single_crochet of row 2 will need to be behind the tail row 2 *increase in every single_crochet* repeat around 12 stitches row 3 *increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 1* repeat around 18 stitches row 4 single_crochet 18 18 stitches row 5 the back feet of the elephant are in this row single_crochet 7 6
